intro: Memecylon tirunelvelicum, commonly known as the Nilgiri memecylon, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by elliptical, woody fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
